metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1083 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Zsh before version 5.4.2-test-1 is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the shell autocomplete functionality. A local unprivileged user can create a specially crafted directory path which leads to code execution in the context of the user who tries to use autocomplete to traverse the before mentioned path. If the user affected is privileged, this leads to privilege escalation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1083` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

zsh - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.2
zsh-common - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.2
zsh-static - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zsh package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.1-1ubuntu2.2').
